result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine C Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying A Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Sign up for probation no later than 10/14/22.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and compliance with treatment.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No firearms.
No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

Submit a DNA sample by 10/14/22 and pay the surcharge during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in  a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jermaine C Wilson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jermaine C Wilson in court.  Attorney Tyler David Rasmussen in court for Jermaine C Wilson.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case 
for the purpose of sentencing. 
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Court finds victim notification has been complied with.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 90 DAYS concurrent in the House of Correction, credit of 5 days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/14/22.
- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No firearms.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/14/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay ALL costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, filed.  rmm

At the request of the defense, the 9/08/22 status conference is vacated and matter set for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Defendant's Request for Adjournment, filed.  rmm

Defendant Jermaine C Wilson in court with attorney Tyler David Rasmussen.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Rasmussen has received discovery but not an offer and requests another status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07-07-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Jermaine C Wilson in court with attorney Tyler David Rasmussen.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 1.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Request Track Multiple Cases, filed.  rmm

Adjustment Number: 22A 057548,
Payable Number: 1014900,
Receipt Number: 22RP025166,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-5-2022 @2:30p
